justification: “We assessed subjective well-being by using the German Single-Item Scale L1 (Beierlein et al., 2014).”

measured_by: 4-item Anxiety subscale of the Achievement Emotions Questionnaire (AEQ)
justification: “Measuring anxiety in a learning context, four items … of the Achievement Emotions Questionnaire (AEQ), developed by Pekrun et al. (2005) were adapted to the academic context.”

measured_by: 5-item subscale of the SESSKO (German Scales for the Assessment of School’s Self-Concept)
justification: “To assess academic self-concept, we used a five-item subscale from the German scales for the assessment of school's self-concept (SESSKO; Schöne et al., 2002), adapted to the academic context.”
“We measured subjective task value with a six-item scale that we had already used in several prior studies (e.g., Authors, 2019).”

measured_by: Short version (10 items) of the German translation of the Tuckman Procrastination Scale (TPS)
justification: “Assessing academic procrastination, we used a short version of the German translation of the Tuckman Procrastination Scale (TPS, Stöber & Joormann, 2001; Tuckman, 1991) with ten items …”
“To measure learned helplessness in the academic context, we adopted and extended the helplessness scale of Breitkopf (1985), resulting in six items.”

measured_by: Newly developed multifaceted Dropout Intention Scale (5 phases, 3 items each)
justification: “To measure the assumed phases of the process of intentions to quit studies completely … we newly developed two versions of a multifaceted scale … We assessed each phase by using three items.”

measured_by: Newly developed multifaceted Change-Major Intention Scale (5 phases, 3 items each)
justification: “To measure the assumed phases of the process of … intentions to change a major, we newly developed two versions of a multifaceted scale … We assessed each phase by using three items.”
